title: How does the Constitution reflect the principle of limited government? - Quora

response.answer_text: How does the Constitution reflect the principle of limited government? The US Constitution reflects the principle of DEFINED government. Some functions are limited while others are unlimited. No person in their right mind would put an across the board limitation of government that might entirely cripple the fundamental purpose of having a government. Your government is staffed by your fellow citizens perhaps family relatives and neighbors. However, the concept of “limited” government comes from opposition to monarchies with unlimited powers and divine powers. The point of making governments as republics is to obstruct re-establishment of monarchy. A republic is an anti-monarchy. A republic enables the citizens to define any and all functions considered important. Good luck America.
The Constitution simply outlines the structure of our government, limiting the power of the federal government, and leaving any unenumerated powers to the states.
